column4: damn it I removed gcc-4.0-base and it removed aptitude, apt-utils and apt
how can i get that back since i don't have apt anymore
you still have a bunch of .deb files in /var/cache/apt/archives/ ?
hopefully "sudo dpkg -i /var/cache/apt/archives/apt*.deb" will sort you out
actually, you might want to be a bit more careful about exactly which .deb files you use, but you get the idea
you're going to have to chase down the dependencies yourself, but hopefully they'll all be in that cache dir
if not, you can use http://packages.ubuntu.com/ to hunt them down.
makes you appreciate apt-get doesn't it?
I just tried removing gcc-4.0-base, and it told me: The following packages will be REMOVED cpp-4.0 g++-4.0 gcc-4.0 gcc-4.0-base libstdc++6-4.0-dev
no idea why it took apt-get away from you
are you sure you didn't accidentally type 'sudo apt-get remove gcc-4.0-base apt'?
if I try that it won't let me: dpkg: dependency problems prevent removal of gcc-4.0-base:
did you just run "sudo dpkg -r gcc-4.0-base", and that took lots of stuff with it?
or did you use an extra flag to tell it to remove dependencies too?
